request_pathways.name: Request for Release of Health Information form

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients are directed to a Zoho-based online portal or a generic ROI authorization form that uses third-party release language for all record requests.

red_flags: Social Security Number field required on the form — unnecessary for records requests and creates privacy risk
Witness signature line implies a witness is needed, adding a barrier with no HIPAA basis for patient self-access
Sensitive information (substance abuse, psychiatric, STD, HIV/AIDS) bundled into general authorization without separate consent, potentially conflicting with 42 CFR Part 2
Form references outdated organization name ('Springhill Memorial Hospital') and obsolete billing form ('UB-92'), indicating no updates since 2011
bright_spots: Five delivery method options including fax, email, and patient portal — forward-looking for a 2011-era form
Zoho-based online ROI request portal provides a fully digital submission alternative
ONC patient rights infographic hosted on Medical Records page shows awareness of patient access rights
Explicit non-conditioning statement: treatment/payment cannot be conditioned on signing the authorization
Single-page form design minimizes patient burden

findability.rationale: Level 4: Form found easily via web search and linked directly from the Medical Records page; Zoho portal also prominently available — basic navigation suffices.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: The PDF form has no fillable fields (print-and-handwrite required), but fax and email submission are available; the Zoho online portal provides a digital workaround for submission.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate single-page layout with logical flow, but notable problems including SSN field, dense legal block, outdated references, and no instructions for patient self-access.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the generic ROI form but it was not designed for self-access — the 'authorize release to' structure requires patients to figure out how to request their own records.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements exceed what the law requires — SSN collection, witness signature field, and bundled sensitive-information consent go beyond HIPAA's patient access requirements, though revocability and non-conditioning statements are present.

overall.summary: Springhill Medical Center offers a findable but dated generic ROI form with unnecessary barriers (SSN, witness) and no patient self-access differentiation; the Zoho online portal provides a meaningful digital alternative.
